title: Mexicans hold mass protests over law weakening electoral authority
description: Many of President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s critics worry the law passed last week is aimed at keeping his party in power in presidential elections next year.

title: Panama suspends migrant transfers after bus accidents
description: The government of Panama has temporarily bus services that transfer migrants from the dangerous Darien Gap area to the north of the country, after two serious mishaps aboard the vehicles

title: In India, ‘phase down’ of coal actually means rapid expansion of mining
description: The world’s second-largest consumer of coal is not ready to give it up, despite urgent concerns about the toll it’s taking on the climate.

title: Heavy snow, wind causes traffic chaos in Balkan countries
description: Croatian authorities have closed all roads connecting the country’s mainland with the Adriatic Sea coastline because of heavy snow and strong winds that sparked traffic chaos in the country and elsewhere in the region

title: Tens of thousands protest Mexico electoral reforms
description: Tens of thousands of people filled Mexico City’s vast main plaza to protest electoral law reforms that they say threaten democracy

title: After warnings, no evidence China is supplying arms to Russia, U.S. officials say
description: "China has not moved forward" with supplying lethal weapons to Russia for its war in Ukraine, though U.S. intelligence suggests the superpower is weighing such a move.

title: Greeks revel in Carnival celebrations after pandemic pause
description: Throngs of revelers across Greece have attended end-of-Carnival celebrations for the first time in four years

title: Group: 22 Syrian migrants on hunger strike in Libyan prison
description: A rights group says at least 22 Syrian migrants detained for more than five months in Libya have begun a hunger strike to demand their release

title: Replace tomatoes with turnips? U.K. official’s tip is root of new shortage.
description: Thérèse Coffey's suggestion that Britons eat turnips amid a shortage of tomatoes, peppers and other salad ingredients sparked a rush of sales and widespread criticism.

title: Rena Gluck, modern dancer who reshaped Israeli stage, dies at 89
description: Ms. Gluck, who move to Israel in 1954, built links between Israeli dancers and her former teacher, the famed choreographer Martha Graham.

title: Fleeing Nicaraguans a boon to economy back home
description: Remittances to Nicaraguans sent home last year surged 50%, a massive jump that analysts say is directly related to the thousands of Nicaraguans who emigrated to the U.S. in the past two years

title: Afghan refugees in Pakistan protest delay in US resettlement
description: Hundreds of Afghan refugees facing extreme delays in the approval of U.S. visas are protesting in Pakistan’s capital on, as an American program to help relocate at-risk Afghans fleeing Taliban rule stalls

title: In heart of Haiti's gang war, one hospital stands its ground
description: One hospital is standing its ground in one of the most violent parts of Haiti’s capital

title: 3 killed when African Union helicopter crashes in Somalia
description: The crash of a helicopter belonging to the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia has killed three people and injured eight others

title: Putin says Russia cannot ignore NATO nuclear capability
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said in an interview that his country has no choice but to take into account NATO’s nuclear capabilities

title: Second BTS member begins enlistment process for South Korea’s military
description: J-Hope, also known as Hobi, applied to end the postponement of his mandatory military service, Big Hit Music said. Bandmate Jin enlisted last year.

title: Voting continues in Nigeria, a day after polls due to close
description: People are still voting across Nigeria, one day after Africa’s most populous nation went to the polls to vote for presidential and parliamentary elections

title: On Ukraine front, civilians cling on as troops repel Russia
description: On the largely static front line between Ukrainian and Russian forces that stretches over hundreds of kilometers (miles), Vuhledar has become one of the deadliest hotspots

title: Dozens dead after migrant boat breaks apart near Italian coast
description: The boat sank off Italy's Calabrian coast as migration to Europe, including by traffickers, is spiking. Authorities say the death toll is almost certain to rise.

title: 3 Hungarians killed after car, bus collide on Austrian pass
description: Police say three Hungarians have died after the car they were in collided with a bus on a snowy Alpine pass in Austria

title: Israel, Palestinian officials to meet over surge in violence
description: The Palestinian president’s office says a high-level Palestinian delegation will meet with top Israeli officials in Jordan

title: Egypt speaker, Arab lawmakers visit Syrian President Assad
description: Egypt’s parliament speaker is heading a Mideast delegation on a visit to Syria for talks with President Bashar Assad

title: Russia, Iran sending top envoys to UN's human rights council
description: The latest session of the Human Rights Council opens Monday with the U.N. secretary-general joining three presidents to speak, and foreign ministers from countries including France, Germany and Iran set to attend

title: On buses and balconies, Venezuela’s citizen reporters take news to the people
description: Independent journalists are sidestepping state-controlled media and censorship in a program that has been funded by the U.S. and other governments.

title: Hong Kong model’s in-laws face charges in grisly killing
description: Police in Hong Kong have filed murder charges against the former in-laws of a model, days after her body parts were found in a refrigerator

title: Bus overturns in Croatia, killing 1, injuring 4
description: Croatian police say a bus has overturned in the west of the country, killing one person and injuring several

title: Ex-husband’s relatives charged in Hong Kong model’s slaying
description: Police did not name the victim, but she was widely reported to be Abby Choi, 28. Police said they caught the victim’s ex-husband attempting to flee by boat.

title: Reports: Migrant boat breaks apart off Italy, about 30 dead
description: Italian state radio says the coast guard has recovered about 30 bodies after a migrant boat broke apart in rough seas off the southern coast of Italy’s mainland

title: Papua New Guinea kidnappers release last 3 hostages
description: Australian Foreign Minister Penny Wong says that an Australian-based archaeologist and two Papua New Guinea nationals have been released from captivity after being taken hostage by an armed group in a remote part of Papua New Guinea several days ago

title: Young doctors are leaving Egypt in droves for better jobs abroad
description: Disillusioned over low pay and difficult working conditions, more than 11,500 doctors left Egypt’s public health sector between 2019 and 2022.

title: Japan’s military ignored her sexual assault claims, so she went public
description: Rina Gonoi was sexually assaulted in the Japanese military, but the system didn't listen to her complaints. So she went public and got results — and trolling.

title: Bombing in crowded bazaar in southwestern Pakistan kills 5
description: Police say a bombing at a crowded bazaar in southwestern Pakistan killed at least five people and wounded 16

title: Ukraine live briefing: China to host Kremlin ally Lukashenko amid worries about Beijing’s stance on the war
description: China will host Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko, an ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin, amid concerns Beijing is weighing lethal aid to Moscow.
